manipulation.sound

Class AudioEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • manipulation.sound.AudioEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Encoder

    public class AudioEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
implements Encoder

    This class is used to encode and decode a hidden message within a audio media file.

      • encode_msg

        public byte[] encode_msg(WorkFile file,
                         byte[] message,
                         short bitsPerByteForEncoding,
                         java.lang.String passwordKey)
                  throws MessageTooLargeException

        Encodes a given string message within a given AudiInputStream covertext using Least Significant Bit embedding.

        The embedding process is as follows:

        (1) The message byte array is joined to the end of the message-length byte array, forming an byte array containing the message-length, and the message.

        (2) This array is embedding into the image data using the BPB(Bits Per Byte value)

        (3) All of the LSB data from the image is extracted into a single byte array, forming an array of all the LSB data which fits within the Encryption cipher algorithm's block size. This means the array's size will be the length of the image data array, rounded down to the lowest multiple of 16, minus 16 - the minus 16 required due to the padding scheme adding an extra block is the data is full.

        (4) This LSB data is encrypted using the Encryption Cipher, using a hashed version of the supplied string key.

        (5) This, now encrypted LSB data, is reinserted back into the audio data LSB

        Citation (embedding process follows the principles of):
        http://www.dreamincode.net/forums/topic/27950-steganography/

        Specified by:
        encode_msg in interface Encoder
        Parameters:
        file - the covertext which is used to hide the given message.
        message - the byte array message which is to be hidden within the given covertext.
        bitsPerByteForEncoding - the amount of bits per byte of the image data which will be used to hide the message.
        passwordKey - the string key which will be used as the encryption cipher's key
        Returns:
        a byte array of the audio data, altered to contain the message
        Throws:
        MessageTooLargeException - if the message is too large to be hidden in the given covertext.

      • decode_msg

        public byte[] decode_msg(WorkFile file,
                         java.lang.String passwordKey)
                  throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException

        Decodes a hidden message from a given AudioInputStream stegotext, reversing the technique used in the encoding process.

        The recovery process is as follows:

        (1) The LSB data is recovered from the image data to form a single byte array containing the LSB data.

        (2) - The supplied string password is used to get it's hashed equivalent. This hashed key is then used by the encryption cipher to get the plaintext LSB data.

        (3) - The message length value is extracted from the LSB data, using the first 4 bytes to form an integer, which informs how long the message is (in bytes).

        (4) - Using the recovered message length, the algorithm nows how many elements of the LSB data are part of the message, thus it recovers the relevant bytes, which are returned.

        Specified by:
        decode_msg in interface Encoder
        Parameters:
        file - the WorkFile stegotext which contains the hidden message.
        passwordKey - the string key which will be used as the encryption cipher's key
        Returns:
        the byte array message recovered from the stegotext.
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException

      • encode_msg

        @Deprecated
public static javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream encode_msg(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream audio,
                                                                           java.lang.String message,
                                                                           int bitsPerByteForEncoding,
                                                                           EncodeController eC)
                                                                    throws MessageTooLargeException
        Deprecated. 

        Encodes a hidden message within a audio file, in AudioInputStream format, using various degrees of least significant bit embedding.

        All of the various inputs are converted to bytes for easier manipulation during the embedding process.

        Before the message itself is encoded into the audio file, the amount of bits per byte being used to encode the message, is encoded into the audio first (using 1bit lsb embedding). After that, the length of the message (in bytes) encoding into the audio file, being an integer value, takes from up from 4 to 32 bytes of the audio bytes based upon the bits per byte parameter.

        Once the length has been encoded, the message itself is encoded within the audio file. Similarly to the message length encoded before, the message's bytes are encoded using the least significant bits in each byte of image data, requiring from 1 to 8 bytes of image data per byte of message.

        Citation (encoding process follows the principles of):
        http://www.dreamincode.net/forums/topic/27950-steganography/

        Parameters:
        audio - the covertext which is used to hide the given message.
        message - the String message which is to be hidden within the given covertext.
        bitsPerByteForEncoding - the amount of bits per byte of the audio data which will be used to hide the message.
        eC - the EncodeController of which this method is called from (used for callbacks to update the encoding progress)
        Returns:
        the AudioInputStream stegotext containing the hidden message
        Throws:
        MessageTooLargeException - if the message is too large to be hidden in the given covertext.

      • decode_msg

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String decode_msg(javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream audio,
                                                       DecodeController d)
        Deprecated. 

        Decodes a hidden message from a given AudioInputStream stegotext, using the same Least Significant Bits technique used to encode the message.

        Firstly, the the amount of bits per byte data is decoded from the stegotext, which is embedded in the first 4 bytes of data.

        Next, the length of the hidden message is decoded from the given audio file via extracting the first 1 to 4 bytes worth of LSB's from the audio data and constructing an integer from this data.

        The length value is used to know how much of the audio data contains the hidden message, which allows the decoder to form a string from the extracted data without misinterpreting bit values which are not related to the hidden message

        Parameters:
        audio - the AudioInputStream stegotext which contains the hidden message.
        d - the DecodeController of which this method is called from (used for callbacks to update the decoding progress)
        Returns:
        the String message decoded from the stegotext.

      • getMaxMessageSize

        public static long getMaxMessageSize(WorkFile file,
                                     short bitsPerByteForEncoding)

        Used to calculate how much space (in bytes) a given audio stegotext has for hiding message bits. The bytes available for the message equal to: (((total_audio_bytes - bits_per_byte_bytes) * bits_per_byte) / 8) - message_length_bytes

        Parameters:
        file - the covertext workFile
        bitsPerByteForEncoding - the amount of bits per stegotext byte allocated for encoding
        Returns:
        the amount of space available for a hidden message in the covertext
